content:
けしからぬ〔怪しからぬ〕
〈形〉Scandalous (conduct); outrageous, atrocious (behaviour); impertinent, impudent, insolent (doings); cursed, confounded (fellow)

content.content: こりゃけしからん
Impertinence!―Confound you!―This is too much!
貴様はけしからぬ奴だ
What a confounded fellow you are!
あれはけしからぬ奴だ
He is an impertinent fellow―an impudent fellow―an insolent fellow.
けしからぬ奴め
Wretch!―Miscreant!

It is outrageous behaviour―atrocious behaviour―scandalous conduct.
そんなことを言うとはけしからん
It is impertinent of him to say such things.
金をくれとはけしからん
It is impudent of him to ask for money.
こんな手紙を寄越すとはけしからん
It is insolent of him to write me such a letter.
こんなけしからん手紙を寄越した
He wrote me such an insolent letter―such an impertinent letter.
貴様はけしからんことを言う
You are impertinent.
今日休むとはけしからん
It is outrageous that he should absent himself on this important occasion.
茶代百円とはけしからん
One hundred yen tea-money is outrageous―atrocious.
けしからん風聞が立っている

女に対してけしからん挙動に及ぶ
to take liberties with―take freedoms with―attempt familiarities with―a woman

content: 2. (=様子)appearance

to throw a wet blanket over one's project―throw cold water on one's scheme
あの男はよく人のことにケチをつけたがる
He is a damper.

an unlucky house

content.content: けち臭い奴だ
He is a stingy fellow―a miser―a skinflint―as close as a vice.

けちけちする

content.content: けちけちするな
Don't be so stingy!
彼がけちけちしてためた金だ
He saved the money by shaving close―by pinching and scraping.
あの女はどんなにけちけちしても身なりだけはくずさぬ
She will pinch and scrape to keep up a good appearance.

content:

content.content: 敵を蹴散らす
to rout the enemy―drive the enemy like sheep
ロシア人は日本軍を蹴散らそうと思ったのだ
The Russians thought of driving the Japanese like sheep.

〈名〉A miser; a niggard; a skinflint; a scrape-penny; a screw; a curmudgeon; an old hunks; a stingy fellow; a close-fisted fellow

〈名〉Decision; division

content.content: 決を採る
to take a vote―decide by vote―divide on the question
決を採ってみると反対者が多数であった
On division, the opponents were found to be in the majority.

content.content: 尻掘る
to practise sodomy―bugger

a hemadynamometer

content.content: けっしん〔決心〕

content:
けついん〔欠員〕
〈名〉A vacancy

content.content: どの級にも欠員がない
There is no vacancy in any of the classes.
欠員があったらその人を使ってみよう
I will employ the man when there is a vacancy.
近々に欠員を生ずる
A vacancy will occur shortly.
この地位に欠員を生じた
The position has become vacant―fallen void.
事務員が一人辞職してその地位が欠員になっている
A clerk has left, and the post remains vacant.
欠員を補充する
to fill up vacancies―replenish the ranks―recruit the army
欠員募集
an invitation to fill up vacancies

content:
けつえき〔血液〕
〈名〉Blood

content.content: 血液が循環する
Blood circulates―Blood flows in the veins.
血液の循環
circulation of blood
血液の循環を好くする
to promote the circulation of blood
血液を清める
to purify the blood
血液学
hematology

けつえん〔欠円〕
〈名〉A segment of a circle

content:

〈名〉Consanguinity; blood-relationship; ties of blood:(=の) consanguineous

content.content: 血縁者
a blood-relation
血縁は争われない
“Blood is thicker than water.”

けっか〔欠課〕
〈名〉Absence from a class:(=する) to absent oneself from a class; to cut a class

content:
けっか〔結果〕
〈名〉
1. (=原因結果の結果)effect

content.content: 原因結果
cause and effect
結果は原因による(結果あれば必ず原因あり、原因あれば必ず結果を生ずる)
The effect depends on the cause.
原因結果の関係(因果関係)
causal dependence

content: 2. (=自然の結果)consequence

content.content: 自然の結果
a natural consequence
人は勉強すれば自然の結果として上達する道理だ
If a man works hard, it follows as a natural consequence that he will improve.
必然の結果
a necessary consequence
人は取るより多く使えば必然の結果として借金をする道理だ
If a man spends more than he earns, it follows as a necessary consequence that he will run into debt.
物価騰貴は戦争の結果だ
The rise in prices is consequent on the war―due to the war―The prices have risen in consequence of the war―owing to the war.
彼が金持ちになったのは勉強した結果だ
He has grown rich in consequence of his industry―He worked so hard that he has grown rich―Industry has made him rich.
彼の財政混乱は人まかせの結果だ
His affairs are in confusion in consequence of their being left in other hands―His affairs are in confusion, because they are left in other hands.

content: 3. (=成績)result

content.content: 試験の結果が早く聞きたい
I am anxious to know the result of my examination.
結果は良好だ
The results are excellent.
結果は予想に反する
The result is contrary to expectation.
この結果なら満足だ
I am satisfied with the result―The result is satisfactory.
結果が思わしくない
The result is unsatisfactory.
結果を見て驚いた
I am surprised at the result.
結果を見て失望した
I am disappointed at the result.
戦争は好い結果を生じた
The war has produced good results.
この方法は結果が挙がる
The process gives good results―shows good results.
結果が挙がらぬ
It gives no result―shows no result.
放蕩の結果はこうなる(こういう結果になる)
Dissipation leads to this result―This comes of dissipation.
あのようなぜいたくの結果はどうなるか
What will be the result of such extravagance?―What result will such extravagance lead to?―What will come of such extravagance?
あのぜいたくの結果は破滅となるのみだ
Such extravagance can but result in ruin―end in ruin―lead to ruin.
いずれにしても同じ結果になる
Both lead to the same result.
会議は何の結果も無かった
The conference led to no result―came to nothing―Nothing came of the conference―The conference was attended with no results.
互いに譲歩した結果問題がたちまち解決した
We made mutual concessions, with the result that the matter was settled at once―The matter was settled at once in consequence of our mutual concessions.
勉強した結果一番になった

I worked hard with the result that I gained the top-seat―I gained the top-seat in consequence of my diligence―I worked hard, and consequently gained the top-seat―I worked so hard that I gained the top-seat.
この戦争は貿易上の戦争の結果だ
The war resulted from commercial rivalry―Commercial rivalry resulted in this war.
試みの結果はうまくいかなかった(失敗に帰した)
The attempt resulted in a failure―ended in a failure.
君の病気は飲み過ぎる結果だ
Your illness is the result of drinking too much―Your illness results from drinking too much―Your illness comes of drinking too much―Your illness is due to over-indulgence in wine.

content:
〈注意〉以下英語を標準とす。
4. End(は結末)

content.content: これはいったいどういう結果になるだろうか
I wonder what will be the end of all this―How will all this end?
会議は結果が無かった
The conference came to no end―came to nothing.

content: 5. Event(は成功失敗などの結果)

content.content: 全力を尽して結果を待て(人事を尽して天命を待つ)
Do your best, and abide by the event.

content: 6. Issue

content.content: 議事の結果はどうであったか
What was the issue of the proceedings?
何事もこの戦いの結果次第だ
Everything depends on the issue of this battle―the event of this battle.

content: 7. Fruit

content.content: 好い結果を生む
to bear good fruit
彼の富は勉強の結果である
His wealth is the fruit of his industry.
戦勝の結果を納める
to reap the fruits of victory

content: 8. Outcome

content.content: 彼の成功は多年の勉強の結果である
His success is the outcome of years of diligence.

content: 9. Upshot

content.content: 事の結果妥協が成立した
The upshot of the matter was, that a compromise was made.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉In consequence of; owing to; on; after

content.content: 軍備制限の結果幾千の職工が職を失った

Thousands of operatives have been thrown out of employment in consequence of the armament limitation―Owing to the armament limitation, thousands of operatives has been thrown out of employment―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The armament limitation has thrown thousands of operatives out of employment.
問い合わせの結果、評判は事実無根を判明した
On enquiry, the report proved to be unfounded.
調査の結果、新事実が発覚した
On investigation, some new facts have come to light―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Investigation has brought some new facts to light.
検査の結果、物品の半数は不合格
On examination, half the goods were found ineligible.
診察の結果、肺結核と断定した
On examination, it was pronounced to be pulmonary tuberculosis.
開票の結果、最高点は田中氏に帰せり
On the ballot being opened, Mr. Tanaka was found to have obtained the largest number of votes.
熟考の結果、事を中止した
The scheme was abandoned after due deliberation.

月給をいくら取るか

結局は損をせずにすんだというわけさ

結局の勝利は我れに帰した

content: 〈副〉Eventually; in the event; in the end; in the result; in the issue; in the sequel; in the final event; in the final analysis; in the long run; in fine; after all; after all is said and done

結局皆同じことになる

結局無事に治まるだろう

Owing to illness I am unable to attend to my duties today―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness prevents my attending to my duties today.
田中氏病気欠勤に付、同氏受持時間は本日休業す

content.content: 月桂冠を戴く、月桂冠を獲る
to win laurels―carry off the honours
この日の月桂冠は慶応の頭上に落ちた

content.content: 撃劔の稽古をする

a fencing-match

a fencing-hall―a fencing-school

〈名〉Decisive action; resolute action; prompt action; a decisive step:(=する) to take decisive action; to take resolute action; to take prompt action; to take a decisive step; to dare:(他動詞に用いれば)to effect (a reform); to carry out (a design, etc.)

content.content: 彼は大改革を決行した
He promptly effected a drastic reform.

運を天に任して決行する
to cross the Rubicon

content:

content.content: この演劇の結構が好い
I like the plot of the play―The play is well got up.
この小説は結構が悪い
The novel is defective in plot―ill got up.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=好い)good (thing); excellent (article); fine (weather); nice (present); delicious (food); exquisite (workmanship, etc.)

content.content: それでけっこう
That's good―That's right―That'll do.
これならけっこうだ
It is quite good―It might be worse.
けっこうなお天気です
It is fine weather―Lovely weather, isn't it?
けっこうな新年です
Happy New Year!
けっこうな品を頂戴してありがとう存じます
Thanks for your nice present!
お雑煮はけっこうです
The New Year's dish is excellent.
お吸物もけっこうです
The soup is delicious.
けっこうな細工です
It is exquisite workmanship.
日光を見ずに結構と言うな
Never say “kekko” before you see Nikko.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: けっこうなご身分です
Yours is an enviable position.
けっこうなお住居ですね
You have quite a home here.
羽織袴でけっこうだ
Haori and hakama will do.
そのままでけっこうです
I like it as it is―I don't wish it otherwise.
(芝居へ行かないかと言われて)けっこうです
(Won't you go to the play?) With pleasure―With great pleasure―I shall be delighted―I shall be charmed.
日光行きですか、何よりけっこうです
A trip to Nikko? I should like nothing better―I shall enjoy it of all things.
休みはいつもけっこうだ
A holiday never comes amiss.

content: 2. (=めでたい)I am glad

content.content: 病人が助かったか、そりゃけっこうだ
Is he saved? I am glad of it―That's a mercy.
及第したか、そりゃけっこうだ
Have you passed? I am glad to hear it―I am glad that you have passed.
いつものお達者でけっこうです
I am glad you are always in good health.
達者なのは何よりけっこうだ
Health is above everything else.
戦争がすんでけっこうだ
I am glad the war is over―I am glad of the war being over.
ご繁昌でけっこうです
I am glad you are doing so well.
どうなりこうなり暮らしていけりゃけっこうだ
We must be content if we can get along anyhow.
血を見ずに治まるならけっこうだ
It is well if the matter can be settled without bloodshed.

content: 〈副〉(=十分)quite; very well

content.content: 彼は年を取っていてもけっこう役に立つ

あの男でけっこう間に合う
He will do very well.
この家でけっこう間に合う
This house will answer the purpose very well.
彼がいなくともけっこう間に合う
He can be very well done without.

content:

content.content: あんまは血行を好くする
Shampooing of the body promotes the circulation of blood.

content:

content:
けっこん〔結婚〕
〈名〉Marriage; matrimony; wedlock; union; alliance:(=する) to marry; to get married; to contract a marriage:(上品に言うと)to be united; to enter into the bonds of matrimony; to change one's condition:(こっけいに言うと)to get spliced:(他動詞に用いれば)to marry (a man or a woman); to be married (to some one); to wed (a man or a woman); to be wedded (to some one); to espouse (a woman)

content.content: 君は結婚する気があるか
Have you a mind to get married?
彼女は結婚するにはまだ早い
She is too young to marry―not yet of an age to marry―not yet of a marriageable age.
もう結婚しても好い年だ
She is old enough to marry―of an age to marry―of a marriageable age.
まだ結婚しても好い
She is young enough to marry―still of a marriageable age.
もう結婚するには遅い
She is too old to marry―past her marriageable age.
男が女と結婚する

A woman marries a man―gives her hand to a man―bestows her band upon a man―takes a man for better or for worse.

He had the imprudence to marry beneath him―contract a m?salliance.
素性賤しい者との(不釣合いの)結婚
a m?salliance
金持ちの女と結婚する
to marry a fortune

to marry an heiress

to marry for money

to marry for love

to marry into a family

田中君と御結婚遊ばされ候由大慶に存じ候
Allow me to congratulate you on your happy union with Mr. Tanaka.

an ofter of marriage―a proposal of marriage
結婚を申込む
to make an offer of marriage―make a proposal of marriage―propose to a lady―sue for a lady's hand in marriage―(こっけいに言うと)―pop the question

a marriage ceremony―a wedding―a bridal―nuptials
結婚を披露する
to announce a wedding―give a wedding dinner―hold a wedding banquet
結婚披露会
a wedding dinner―a wedding banquet
(教会で)結婚を予告する

content:
けっして〔決して〕
〈副〉Never:(どんなことがあっても)on no account:(どんな場合にも)in no case; on no occasion; under no circumstances:(決してそんなわけではない)by no means; by no manner of means; no such thing; nothing of the kind:(少しも)not at all; not in the least; not a bit of it; no (=not any):(どう見ても)nowise:(それどころではない)far from:(なにはともあれそればかりは)anything but; the last

content.content: ご恩は決して忘れません
I shall never forget your kindness.
これからあんなところへは決してまいりません
I will never go to such places again.
病気のほかはどんなことがあっても決して学校を休んではいかん
You must not absent yourself from school on any account, unless you are ill―On no account must you absent yourself from school, unless you are ill.
どんなことがあっても決して嘘をつくものでない
You should not tell a lie in any case―under any circumstances―In no case―Under no circumstances―should you tell a lie.
偽りはどんな場合にも決して許すべきものでないか
Is a lie permissible in no case?―under no circumstances?
ロシア人は決して勇気のないわけではない
The Russians are by no means wanting in courage.
決してそんなわけではありません
No such thing!―Nothing of the kind!
値段は決してお高くはありません
The price is not at all high―none too high.
決してご心配には及びません
You need not make yourself uneasy at all.
決してさようではございません
Not at all!―Not a bit of it!
彼は決してそんな人ではない
He is no such man.
決して間違いではない
It is no mistake.
決して偽りは申しません
I am telling no lie.
将来は決してお小言を頂戴するようなことは致しません
You shall have no cause for complaint in future.
この品はあれに(どう見ても)決して劣りません
This article is nowise inferior to that.
彼の英語は決して完全とは言えぬ
His English is far from perfect―anything but perfect.
彼は決して学者とは言えぬ
He is far from being a scholar―anything but a scholar.
彼は決してあやまち無き人とは言えぬ
He is anything but prudent.
彼は決して偽りを言うような人じゃない
He is the last man to tell a lie―He is not the man to tell a lie―He is above telling a lie.［注意］打消に“can”を加えれば (can not)「不可能」「決して」の意味となる。
決して疑い無い
There can be not doubt about it.
君が落第する気遣いは決して無い
There can be not fear of your failing.

〈名〉(目的を遂げなければ止まぬ決心)determination:(一身上に関する決心)resolution; a resolve:(=する) to determine (to accomplish one's purpose); to resolve (to amend one's conduct); to make a resolution; to take one's resolve; to make up one's mind

content.content: 目的を遂行する決心だ
I am determined to accomplish my purpose―I will accomplish my purpose.
どんなことをしても(万難を排して)目的を遂げる決心だ
I will accomplish my purpose at my cost―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
行いを改める決心だ
I am resolved to amend my conduct―I will amend.
敵が和を乞うまで戦う決心だ
We are determined to fight till enemy sues for peace.
彼は復讐をする決心だ
He is resolved to have his revenge.
その時彼は復讐をする決心をした
Then he resolved to revenge himself―resolved on vengeance.
彼らは死を決して戦う決心をした
They determined to fight to the last.
彼はたちまち決心した
His resolve was taken―His mind was made up―in a moment.
その時僕は生涯このことに一身を委ねようと大決心した
Then I made a great resolution―took my great resolve―to devote my life to the cause.
大決心で仕事にとりかかった
I set about my task with an invincible resolution―with set teeth.

決心を固執する(翻さぬ)
to adhere to one's resolution―stick to one's resolve
決心を翻す

どこまでも決心を翻さぬ
I will never swerve from my resolution―I will act up to my resolution.
どんなことがあってもこの決心は翻さぬ
Nothing can turn me from my resolution.
君がいくら笑っても僕は決心を翻さぬ
You can not laugh me out of my resolution.
いくら説いても彼は決心を翻さぬ
I can not talk him out of his resolution.

決心抜くべからず、決心動かすべからず

content:
けっする〔決する〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=決定する)to decide (the day); to come to a decision; to arrive at a decision; to determine (one's fate); to settle (a dispute)

content.content: どうも決しかねる
I can not decide―come to a decision―arrive at any decision.
異説紛々として決するところ無し
There is such a divergence of opinion that no decision can be arrived at.
勝敗を決する
to fight to a finish―fight to the finish―fight it out―(無意志に用いれば)―decide a contest―decide a battle―decide the day
援兵が来たので勝敗を決した
The arrival of reinforcements decided the day―was decisive of the battle.
勝敗を決する決心だ
We are determined to fight to a finish―fight it out.
勝敗未だ決せず
Victory hangs in doubt―hangs in the balance.
勝敗決し難し
It is a doubtful battle―a doubtful day.
雌雄を決する
to fight
雌雄を決しよう
I will try conclusions with you.
いざ雌雄を決せん
Let us see which is the better man!
雌雄を決し難し
It is a close contest.
国家の運命を決する一戦なり
The battle is to decide the fate of the country―determine the fate of the Empire.
争いを決する
to settle a dispute
刃に血塗らずして事を決した
The dispute was settled without bloodshed.
問題を決する
to decide a question―settle a question―dispose of a question
軽々に決すべき問題にあらず
It is not to be lightly disposed of.
決し難き問題である
It is a vexed question.

The assembly is divided in opinion.
衆議遂に決せず

content: 2. (=決心する)to determine; to resolve

content.content: 心を決する
to make up one's mind―determine―resolve
死を決する

content.content: 被告は有罪と決した、無罪と決した

content: 4. (=議決する)to decide on, vote on (a bill or a measure)

content: 5. (=決潰する)to collapse; to break down; to be breached; to give way

What is the cause of the failure?
この失敗には種々の原因がある
The failure is due to various causes.
原因を調査する
to inquire into the cause
原因不明
The cause is unknown.
彼の失敗は無能に原因する
His failure is all owing to―due to―attributable to―ascribable to―to be ascribed to―to be attributed to―his incompetence.
無能が失敗の原因
His incompetence is the cause of his failure―His incompetence is responsible for his failure.
原因に帰す
to attribute anything to its cause
世間では彼の失敗の原因を無能に帰している
People attribute his failure to incompetence.
戦争の原因は
What was the cause of the war?―What did the war arise from?―What did the war originate in?
戦争の原因は勢力争い
The war arose from rivalry―resulted from rivalry―originated in rivalry―began in rivalry.
病の原因は酒
Wine is at the bottom of his illness―at the root of his illness.

げんうん〔眩暈〕
〈名〉Vertigo; dizziness; giddiness

けんえい〔県営〕
〈名〉A prefectural enterprise

content:
けんえき〔検疫〕
〈名〉Medical inspection; quarantine:(=する) to inspect; to quarantine

content.content: 流行地を経過せる船舶はすべて検疫せらる
All vessels coming through the infected localities are quarantined―subjected to quarantine.
船は検疫停船中
The ship is in quarantine.
検疫所
a quarantine station
検疫船
a quarantine ship
検疫官
a quarantine officer―a health-officer
検疫規則
quarantine regulations
検疫旗
the quarantine flag―the yellow flag
検疫ずみ
passed medical inspection

content:
げんえき〔現役〕
〈名〉Active service; service with the colours:(軍艦は)commission

content.content: 彼は今現役だ
He is in active service―on service―serving with the colours.
現役将校
an officer in active service―an officer on the active list
現役兵
men on service―men serving with the colours
二年の現役
two years' service with the colours
現役艦
a ship in commission
軍艦が現役になる
A ship goes into commission.

content:
けんえつ〔検閲〕
〈名〉Inspection; examination:(軍隊のは)review:(出版物のは)censorship:(=する) to inspect; to examine; to review (troops); to censor (publications)

content.content: 軍隊には師団長の検閲がある
The troops are reviewed by the divisional commander.
軍隊の検閲
a review of troops
新聞には厳重な検閲がある
The newspapers are subjected to strict censorship.
新聞の検閲
censorship of the press
出版物の検閲
censorship of publications
外国行の電報は役所で検閲を受ける
Telegrams for foreign countries are censored at the office.
検閲官
a censor
検閲ずみ
censored

content:
けんえん〔嫌厭〕
〈名〉Dislike; disgust; abhorrence; detestation; loathing:(=する) to dislike; to abhor; to detest; to loathe; to be disgusted (with a person or thing―at a vice)

content.content: 彼は蛇蝎{だかつ}の如く嫌厭されている
He is detested―loathed―abhorred.

content:
けんえん〔犬猿〕
〈名〉Dogs and monkeys

content.content: 二人の仲は犬猿もただならず
There is no love lost between them.
犬猿生活
a cat-and-dog life

content:
けんお〔嫌悪〕
〈名〉Dislike; hatred; antipathy; repugnance; abhorrence; detestation:(=する) to dislike, hate, abhor, detest, loathe (a person or thing); to be averse to (work); to have a dislike to (a person); to have a hatred for (foreigners); to have an antipathy to (cats); to have a repugnance to (pain, etc.)

content.content: すべて生物は痛みを嫌悪する
All living things have a repugnance to pain.
恋愛の如きは彼の最も嫌悪するところ
He abhors love―Anything akin to love is abhorrent to his feelings.
あれは嫌悪すべき奴だ
He is a detestable fellow―a loathsome fellow.

けんおんき〔検温器〕
〈名〉A clinical thermometer

content:
けんか〔喧嘩〕
〈名〉
1. (=口論)a quarrel; a dispute; an altercation; a wrangle; a jangle; a brangle; a squabble; a bicker:(=する) to quarrel, dispute, altercate, wrangle, jangle, brangle, squabble, bicker (with any one); to fall out (with one's relations); to break, split (with one's partner); to have words (with any one)

content.content: 彼は校長とけんかした
He has quarrelled with his principal.
二人は逢えば必ずけんかだ
The two never meet without quarrelling.
兄弟が身代のことでけんかした
The brothers quarrelled about―quarrelled over―the inheritance.
二人はけんかして別れた
They parted in anger.
彼は仲間とけんかして別れた
He has broken with―split with―his partner.
彼は親父とけんかして学資が止まった
He has fallen out with his relations, and had his allowance stopped.
ドイツ皇帝は大将に会って大げんかがあった
The Kaiser saw the general, and there was a stormy scene.
二人は大げんかをやった
There was a stormy scene between the two.
僕はあの人とけんかした
I have quarrelled with him―I am out with him.
けんかを仕かける、けんかを吹かける
to pick a quarrel with one―fasten a quarrel on one―force a quarrel on one
けんかを売る
to provoke a quarrel
けんかを買う
to take up a quarrel
なにも人のけんかを買うにも及ぶまい
Why should I make another's quarrel my own?
売られたけんかなら買わずばなるまい
If he seeks a quarrel with me, he is welcome.
けんかを焚きつける
to fan a quarrel―fan a flame―feed the fire―add fuel to the fire―pour oil on the fire―blow the coals―stir the embers―stir up a strife
したがるけんかなら何でも焚きつけになる
When people are disposed to quarrel, anything does to feed the fire.
あの男はけんかを焚きつけることが好きだ
He is a firebrand.
けんかを鎮める
to settle a dispute
けんかを預かる
to take it upon oneself to settle the dispute
このけんかは僕が預った
Let me settle the dispute!
けんかの仲裁する
to mediate between the disputants
けんかに花が咲いた
The quarrel created a sensation.
けんかの火の手が盛んだ
The dispute is running high―Words are running high.
けんかの側杖を喰う
to get a by-blow in another's quarrel―be involved in a quarrel―be embroiled in a quarrel
けんかの相手
some one to quarrel with
けんかの相手は無いか
Will any one quarrel with me?
そんなけんかの相手にはならぬ
I will be no party to such a quarrel.
相手の無いけんかはできぬ
“It takes two to make a quarrel.”
相手の無いけんかをする
to fight windmills
けんかなら持って来い俺が相手になってやる
If it is a quarrel, I am your man.
子どものけんかへ親が出る(ものでない)
Parents should not interfere in children's quarrels.
夫婦げんか
a conjugal quarrel
内輪げんかをする
They quarrel among themselves.
相対げんか
a got-up quarrel
あの男はけんか好きだ
He is a quarrelsome fellow―a combative fellow―a pugnacious fellow.
けんかの種
the seeds of strife―the ground of quarrel―the bone of contention―the apple of discord
けんかの種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of strife
三人連れはけんかの基
“Three is no company.”
けんか両成敗
When people quarrel, both parties are to blame.
けんか口論を慎むべし
You should refrain from quarrelling and altercation.
河向こうのけんかだ
The matter does not concern me―That's no concern of mine―That's none of my business.

content: 2. (=闘争)a fight:(=する) to fight

content.content: 犬がけんかする
Dogs fight.
犬がたわむれにけんかの真似をする
Dogs fight in play.
犬にけんかをさせる
to set dogs fighting―fight dogs
あの男はいつもけんかをしたがっている
He is always ready to fight―eager to fight―spoiling for a fight.
けんかなら来い
If you want a fight, I am your man―my fists are at your service.
けんかを引き分ける
to part the combatants―get between the combatants―pull (or draw) the combatants apart
けんか腰になる
to show fight―cut up rough―assume a defiant attitude

content:
けんか〔県下〕
〈名〉The country under the jurisdiction of the prefecture

content.content: 県下を巡回する
to make a tour of the prefecture
県下の中学校
the middle schools in the prefecture

けんか〔鹸化〕
〈名〉Saponification:(=する) to saponify

content:
けんが〔懸河〕
〈名〉Rapids

content.content: 懸河の弁
a flowing eloquence
懸河の弁を振るう
to exert one's eloquence

content:
けんが〔犬牙〕
〈名〉Indentation

content.content: 海岸線は犬牙相はむ
The coast-line is deeply indented.

content:
げんか〔原価〕
〈名〉The prime cost, the cost-price (of merchandise)

content.content: 原価で売る
to sell at cost-price

content:
げんか〔減価〕
〈名〉A reduced price:(すること)reduction in price; discount:(=する) to reduce the price

content.content: 品物は減価で売っている
The goods are sold at a reduced price―at reduced prices.
二割の減価で売っている
They are sold at 20 percent discount.
減価販売
a discount sale

content:
げんか〔現下〕
〈名〉The present moment; the present hour

content.content: 現下の急務
the pressing need of the moment―the urgent need of the hour

げんか〔絃歌〕
〈名〉A song sung to a string-instrument; music and singing

content:
けんかい〔県会〕
〈名〉A prefectural assembly

content.content: 県会を召集する
to convoke a prefectural assembly
県会議員
a member of the prefectural assembly
県会議長
the president of the prefectural assembly
県会議事堂
the prefectural assembly-hall

content:
けんかい〔見解〕
〈名〉A view, an opinion (on some subject)

content.content: 見解を同じうする
I hold the same opinion―take the same view.
見解を異にする
We differ in opinion on the subject.
この問題についてはおのおの見解を異にしている
They are divided in opinion on the subject.
僕は君と見解を異にする
I view the matter in a different light―I do not view the matter in that light.
彼はどんな問題でも新しい見解を下す
He presents his subject in a new light.
偏した見解
a biassed view of a matter―a prejudiced view of a matter
君の見解は偏している
You have a biassed view of the matter―a prejudiced view of the matter.
これは人々の見解次第だ
It is a matter of opinion.

けんがい〔懸崖〕
〈名〉(上より見れば)a precipice:(下より見れば)a cliff:(海河に向えば)a bluff

げんかい〔限界〕
〈名〉A boundary; a limit; limits; bounds

content:
げんがい〔言外〕
〈形〉Unexpressed, implied (meaning):(=に) outside the words

content.content: 妙は言外に在り
The beauty lies outside the words.
言外に意味あり
More is meant than meets the ear.
言外の意味を取る
to read between the lines
あの人の言うことは言外に意味がある
His statements must be read between the lines.

content:
げんかいちゅうりつ〔厳戒中立〕
〈名〉Armed neutrality

content.content: 厳戒中立を守る
to observe armed neutrality

content:
けんかく〔懸隔〕
〈名〉A difference; a disparity; a discrepancy; an inequality; a distance; an interval; a chasm; a gulf

content.content: 両者の懸隔甚し
There is a wide difference between the two―They are wide apart.
二人の年齢にあまり懸隔がある
There is a disparity of age between the two―They are too unequal in age―Their ages differ too much.
生徒の学力に懸隔がある
The students are unequal in scholarship.
教師と生徒の知識の懸隔が多過ぎてもいけない少な過ぎてもいけない
The distance between the teacher and the student must not be too great or too little.
英国では貧富の懸隔が甚しい
In England, the interval between rich and poor―the chasm between rich and poor―the gulf between rich and poor―is too great.
どんな社会でも貧富の懸隔はしかたがない
The difference in wealth can not be helped in any society.

content:
けんがく〔研学〕
〈名〉Prosecution of study:(=する) to pursue one's studies; to prosecute one's studies

content.content: 彼は研学のために洋行したのだ
He has gone abroad to complete his education.

content:
けんがく〔見学〕
〈名〉Study by inspection and observation:(=する) to study by inspection; to inspect for study; to acquire information by observation

content.content: 見学のために旅行する
to travel for information―make a studious tour
見学のため米国の各工場を見まわった
I visited the American factories for studious purposes.
摂政の宮殿下にはご見学のため九州へならせらる
H. I. H. the Prince Regent makes a studious tour to Kyushu.

content:
げんかく〔厳格〕
〈形〉Severe, strict, stern (with one's inferiors)

content.content: 彼は子どもに厳格だ
He is severe with his children―strict with his children.
彼の父は厳格だ
He has a stern father.
厳格な家庭に育った
He was brought up in a strictly-ordered family.
先生は教場では厳格だが平生は寛大だ
He is strict in class, but indulgent at other times.

げんがく〔減額〕
〈名〉Reduction; discount:(=する) to reduce; to discount

げんがく〔絃楽〕
〈名〉The music of string-instruments

content:
げんがく〔衒学〕
〈名〉Pedantry

content.content: 衒学者
a pedant

content:
けんかごし〔喧嘩腰〕
〈名〉A defiant attitude

content.content: けんか腰になる
to assume a defiant attitude―show fight―cut up rough
あの男はいつもけんか腰だ
He is always defiant―up in arms―spoiling for a fight.

げんがっき〔絃楽器〕
〈名〉A string-instrument; a stringed instrument

content:
げんかに〔言下に〕
〈副〉At a word

content.content: 言下に斥ける
to condemn anything at a word
言下の排斥
a sweeping condemnation

けんかばやい〔喧嘩早い〕
〈形〉Quick to quarrel

げんかはんばい〔減価販売〕
〈名〉A discount sale

けんかん〔兼官〕
〈名〉An additional office; an additional post

けんかん〔鍵関〕
〈名〉The key of the position

けんかん〔顕官〕
〈名〉A high official; a dignitary

げんかん〔厳寒〕
〈名〉Severe cold; intense cold; bitter cold

content:
げんかん〔玄関〕
〈名〉The porch; the portal; the vestibule; the entrance-hall; the front door

content.content: 玄関見付
the hall
玄関から入る
to enter at the front door
馬車を玄関へ着ける
The carriage pulls up at the door.
馬車が威勢好く玄関へ着く
A carriage dashes up to the door.
馬車を玄関へまわせ
Bring the carriage to the door.
馬車をお玄関へまわしました
The carriage is at the door.
玄関の番をする(取次に出る)
to keep the door―mind the door―answer the door
玄関に頼もうという声がする
There is some one singing out at the door.
その家は厳めしい玄関がまえだ
The house has a magnificent front.

けんがんきょう〔検眼鏡〕
〈名〉An ophthalmoscope

content:
げんかんばらい〔玄関払い〕
〈名〉Peremptory refusal of admittance

content.content: 玄関払いを喰わせる
to shut the door in one's face
玄関払いを喰った
I had the door slammed in my face―The door was slammed in my face.

content:
げんかんばん〔玄関番〕
〈名〉The hall porter; the door-keeper; the door-boy

content.content: 玄関番をする
to keep the door―mind the door―answer the door
玄関番をする書生が欲しい
I want a boy to answer the door.
玄関番の書生
the door-boy

けんき〔嫌忌〕
〈名〉Dislike; aversion; antipathy; repugnance; abhorrence; detestation:(=する) to dislike, abhor, detest, loathe (a man); to be averse to (work); to have a dislike to (a man); to have an aversion to (work); to have an antipathy to (cats); to have a repugnance to (pain, etc.)

content:
けんぎ〔嫌疑〕
〈名〉Suspicion

content.content: 嫌疑を受ける
to be suspected―incur suspicion―fall under suspicion
彼は嫌疑を受けた
He fell under suspicion―Suspicion fell upon him.
彼に嫌疑がかかった
Suspicion fell on him―He fell under suspicion.
彼は収賄の嫌疑がある
He is suspected of corruption.
収賄の嫌疑を受けている
He lies under suspicion of corruption.
収賄の嫌疑で逮捕された
He was arrested on the suspicion of corruption.
他殺の嫌疑あり
There is suspicion of foul play.
嫌疑をかける
to suspect one (of a crime)
彼は急に金持ちになって嫌疑を招いた
He incurred suspicion by suddenly becoming rich.
彼は嫌疑を受けるような人でない
His honesty is above suspicion.
嫌疑者
a suspected person―a suspect

content:
けんぎ〔建議〕
〈名〉
1. (=提議)a proposal; a proposition:(=する) to propose; to make a proposition

content.content: 問題を委員に付託することを建議した
I proposed that the question be referred to the committee.
誰の建議で問題を委員に付託したのか
On whose proposition was the question referred to the committee?
建議を握りつぶす
to burke a proposition―stifle up a proposition
建議者
the proposer

content: 2. (=建白)a memorial; a representation:(=する) to memorialize (the government); to represent, make a representation (to the government)

げんき〔元気〕
〈名〉(Animal)spirits; energy; cheerfulness:(相撲や競馬などなら)form

content.content: 元気の好い男だ(元気者だ)
He is a man of spirits―a high-spirited man―a spirited man―a cheery man.
彼はいつも元気だ
He has a remarkable flow of spirits.
あの相撲は元気だ
The wrestler is in form.
元気旺盛
elation of spirits
元気旺盛なり(大元気だ)
He is elated in spirits―in good spirits―in high spirits―in high feather.
選手は元気旺盛なり
The champions are in great form.
元気当たるべからず
He is in roaring spirits―in roaring health.
元気が溢れている
He is exuberant spirits―brimming over with spirits.
元気沮喪
depression of spirits
元気沮喪している(元気揚がらず)
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits―out of spirits―out of sorts―dispirited.
元気をつける
to raise one's spirits―freshen one's spirits―revive one's spirits―(他からなら)―cheer one up―(酒がなら)―exhilarate one
一杯飲んで元気をつけよう
Let us have a drink to raise our spirits!
元気を(失わぬように)保つ
to keep up one's spirits―keep one's pecker up
元気づく
to cheer up―liven up―revive―recover oneself
元気を出せ
Cheer up!―Be of good cheer!
元気をそぐ、元気をくじく
to depress one's spirits―damp one's spirits―cast a damp over one's spirits―strike a damp into one's spirits
元気を落とす
to become depressed―become dispirited―despond
元気を落としている
His spirits are depressed―He is depressed―He is dispirited.
元気を回復する
to recover one's spirits―recover oneself―(病後なら)―pick up (one's crumbs)
休んで元気を回復する
to rest and refresh oneself
休んで元気を回復した
I am rested and refreshed.
病人は追々元気を回復する
The invalid is picking up.
老人は元気が衰えた
The old man has lost his energy.
老いたりといえどももとの元気が衰えぬ
Though old, he has lost none of his energy.
老人はまだなかなかの元気だ
The old man is hale and hearty.
元気の好い青年
a lusty youth
元気の無い若い者
a sickly youth
青年は元気だけの価値だ
A young man is nothing if he has no spirits―nothing without his spirits.
元気溌剌
to be fresh and lively
元気溌剌たる快男子だ
He is a fresh and lively man.
酒は元気をつける、酒を飲むと元気がつく
Wine exhilarates―Wine is exhilarating.
つけ元気
Dutch courage―pot-valour.
あれは例のつけ元気さ
He is pot-valiant, as usual.
空元気
a wanton waste of energy
あの男は空元気を出す
He wastes his energy.

content:
げんき〔衒気〕
〈名〉Affectation; ostentation

content.content: 衒気満々たる才子だ
He is a clever fellow given to ostentation.

げんきづく〔元気付く〕
〈自動〉The cheer up; to liven up; to revive; to be freshened; to be refreshed; to recover oneself

content:
げんきもの〔元気者〕
〈名〉A man of spirits; a spirited man; a high-spirited man

content.content: 彼は一行中の元気者だった
He was the life of the party.

content:
けんきゃく〔健脚〕
〈名〉
1. Pedestrianism

content.content: 彼は健脚自慢だ
He prides himself on his pedestrianism.

content: 2. (=健脚家)a pedestrian; a good walker

content.content: 君はなかなか健脚だ
You are a very good walker―a great pedestrian.

content:
けんきゅう〔研究〕
〈名〉Study; inquiry (into human nature); (scientific) research; (historical) investigation; (philosophical) speculation:(=する) to study (English); to investigate (a matter); to inquire into (human nature); to make researches in (science); to direct one's attention to (a subject)

content.content: 僕もこの事を研究したことがある
I have studied the subject―made a study of the subject―directed my attention to the subject.
そう君のように一々質問しないで少しは自分で研究してみるが好い
You must not ask me everything; you ought to study for yourself―puzzle out for yourself―a little.
英文学を研究する
to study English literature
彼は英文学研究のため外国留学を命ぜられた
He has been ordered abroad to prosecute the study of English literature.
英語を研究する
to study English―learn English
英語研究を始める
to enter upon one's English studies―begin learning English
英語研究日なお浅し
It is only a short time since I began learning English.
これが英語研究の最良法だ
This is the best way to learn English―the most approved method of studying English.
僕は英語研究に興味を持っている
I am interested in the study of English.
彼は英語研究に身を委ねている
He devotes himself to the study of English.
このような本の出るのは英語研究の奨励となる
Such works will give an impetus to the study of English―serve as an impulse to the study of English.
英語は研究しがいがある
English is worth studying―worthy of being studied.
日本の今日あるは外国語の研究与って力あり
The study of foreign languages has helped to make Japan what she is.
科学を研究する
to make researches in science
科学研究
scientific researches
彼は学術研究のため洋行した
He has gone abroad to prosecute his studies.
語源を研究する
to study the etymology of words―trace words to their origin
人情を研究する
to inquire into human nature
深く研究する
to make a deep study of―go deep into―dive into―delve into―a subject
彼は何事も深く研究しない
He never goes deep into anything.
何でも深く研究してみると面白い
“Go deep enough, and there is music everywhere.”
研究するほど興味が増す
The interest deepens with study.
研究を積む
to go through a long course of study
この発明は研究を積んだ結果だ
The invention is the result of a long course of study.
専門に研究する
to make a special study of―made a specialty of―make a study of―a subject
彼は英語を専門に研究したのだ
He has made a study of English.
英語は専門に研究する価値がある
English is worth making a study of―worthy to be made a study of.
彼はドイツ語は達者だが専門に研究したのではない
He is at home in German, but he has not made a specialty of it.
系統的研究
systematic study
英語を系統的に研究する
to make a systematic study of English―study English on system
医学生が実地研究する
A medical student walks the hospital.
研究法
a method of study
英語研究法
a way to learn English
科学的研究法
the scientific method of research
研究問題
a subject for study―a matter for investigation
これは大に研究すべき問題だ
This is a matter that demands full investigation.
研究心
the spirit of inquiry
研究家
a student―an investigator
大学の研究科
a post-graduate course
研究科生
a post-graduate
研究所
a laboratory
研究会
a society for researches and investigations
地震研究会
the society for seismological researches
妖怪学研究
psychical researches
(London の)妖怪学研究会
the Psychical Research Society
研究材料
materials for study
これは心理学研究の好材料だ
This is a study for a psychologist.
研究の新生面を開く
to open a new field of inquiry―break fresh ground
研究範囲を同じうする
to cover the same ground
研究範囲を異にする
to cover different ground

content.content: 僕はなんでも現金で買う
I pay cash for everything―I buy everything for cash.
現金で買うから負けろ
If I pay cash down, you will reduce the price.
現金なら一割引きましょう

All business is done in cash.

現金払割引

C. O. D. (cash on delivery) post.

content: 〈形〉Mercenary; selfish; time-serving; jealous of one's rights; “honest”

content.content: (金をやるとあれだ)支那人は現金だ
“Money makes the Chinaman to go.”―A Chinaman is mercenary.
私が免職になったから娘を取返す、それはあまり現金でしょう
You want your daughter back, because I have lost my place. That is too selfish of you.
旗色が変わると態度を一変する、現金な男だ
He turns his coat at the first turn of the tide. He is a turncoat―a time-server―a weather cock―a very “honest” fellow.
休みだと聞くとすぐ治る、現金な病気だ
Now that you know there is no school, you are well again. What a time-serving illness!―What an “honest” illness!
鐘が鳴ると言いかけたことを半分にして止めてしまう、実に現金な先生だ
When the bell rings, he stops in the midst of a sentence. He is very jealous of his rights―He is very “honest.”
利益が有ると見るとすぐそちらにつく、ずいぶん現金な男だ
He knows on which side the bread is buttered―He is very “honest.”

content.content: 権限を越える
to go beyond one's powers―exceed one's powers―exceed one's authority―exceed one's competence―exceed one's functions―act ultra vires
権限を守る

1. (=堅牢)strong; stout; solid; stable

content.content: 敵は堅固なる陣地に拠る
The enemy holds a strong position.
この家は堅固にできている
The house is strongly built―stoutly built―solidly built.
家は堅固一方にできている
The house is built solely for strength and solidity.
武士道を養うのが帝国を堅固にする一番の保証となる
The cultivation of Bushido is the best guarantee for the stability of the Empire.
要害堅固の城
an impregnable fortress

He is prudent―circumspect.

content: 2. (=強固)firm; strict

content.content: 道徳堅固の名僧
a famous priest of strict morality

content: 3. (=健康)healthy

content.content: ずいぶんともに堅固で
I wish you good health.

content.content: 拳固を喰わせる

content:
げんご〔言語〕
〈名〉Speech; language; words

content.content: 言語を有するは人のみ
Man alone has the gift of speech―Man is the only creature that can speak.
天は人に理性と言語を賦与した
Nature has endowed man with reason and speech.
言語に尽せぬ
It is beyond the power of words―Words are inadequate to express it.
ありがたさは言語に尽せぬ
My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.
その風景言語に絶す
The scenery is beautiful beyond description―The beauty of the scenery baffles description―beggars description―defies description.
象はよく人の言語を解す
The elephant is an intelligent animal.
言語を慎む
to weigh one's words―control one's speech―bridle one's tongue
支度は紳士だが言語挙動は下郎だ
His dress is that of a gentleman, but his speech and behaviour are those of a clown―He dresses like a gentleman, but he speaks and behaves like a clown.
言語挙動に注意せよ
Be careful in your speech and behaviour―Mind your P's and Q's.
言語明晰
He uses perspicuous language.
彼とは言語不通
We can not understand each other―make ourselves understood by each other―make ourselves intelligible to each other―We are ignorant of each other's language.
言語の争いに過ぎず
It is only logomachy.

content:

〈名〉Health:(=の) healthy (man); sound (body); well (man)

content.content: 彼は健康だ
He is healthy―in good health―He enjoys good health.
ありがとう、まことに健康です
Thank you, I am in the best of health―in excellent health―enjoying excellent health―in the enjoyment of excellent health.
禅宗坊主は精進料理を食って健康でいる
The Zen priest thrives on vegetable diet.
彼は健康でない
He is unhealthy―in ill health―out of health.
健康がすぐれない
He is in poor health―in indifferent health―out of sorts.
運動は健康に好い
Exercise is good for the health―beneficial to health.
夜ふかしは健康に悪い
Late hours are bad for the health―injurious to health―detrimental to health.
健康に適する
(仕事)a healthful occupation―(食物)―wholesome food―sanitary diet―(空気)―salubrious air
その地は空気が好くてすこぶる健康に適している
The place is remarkable for the salubrity of its air.
健康を害す
to injure one's health―impair one's health―ruin one's health―be destructive to health
彼はひどく健康を害している
He is in broken health.
彼は勉強をし過ぎて健康を害す
He injures his health by overworking himself―He works himself ill.
過労は健康を害する
Overwork is destructive to health.
健康に害ある
(職業)an unhealthful occupation―(食物)―unwholesome food―unsanitary diet―(空気)―unsalubrious air
健康を保つ
to preserve one's health―keep oneself well
健康を回復する
to recover one's health―be restored to health
健康回復

健康を増進する
to promote one's health―conduce to one's health
適度の運動は健康を増進する
Moderate exercise is conducive to health.
健康が衰える
to fail in one's health―decline in one's health
彼は健康がだんだん衰える
He is failing in his health―in failing health.
健康のありがた味はこれを失って始めてわかる
People do not appreciate the blessing of health till they have lost it.
健康は富貴に勝る
Health is above wealth.
睡眠は健康に必要である
Sleep is necessary to health.
健康は幸福の要素なり
Health is essential to happiness.
(乾盃して)君の健康を祝す
I drink your health―Here's to your health!
健康体

健康体の脈は一分間七十二
The pulse of a man in health is 72 a minute.
健康状態
state of health―the condition of the body
健康診断

健康証明書

content:

content:
けんのん〔険呑〕
〈形〉
1. (=危険)dangerous (experiment); perilous (adventure); hazardous (enterprise); risky (business); unsafe (investment, etc.)

content.content: けんのんなことをする
to brave a danger―run a risk
けんのんなことを止した方がよい
It is better not to run risks.
この投資はけんのんだ
This investment is risky―It is unsafe.
貯蓄銀行にはけんのんな奴がある
Some savings-banks are not safe.
火事が広がるとこの家もけんのんだ
It the fire spreads, this house will be in danger.
あの犬はそばへ寄るとけんのんだ
That dog is not safe to touch.

content: 2. (=不安)unsafe (position); insecure (situation); precarious (existence); unsteady (hand or gait); slippery (ground); ticklish (footing); threatening (sky); touch-and-go (arrangement)

content.content: 空模様がけんのんだ
The sky looks threatening.
けんのんな仕掛けだ
It is a touch-and-go arrangement―a house of cards.
けんのんな立場だ
I have a ticklish footing―I stand on slippery ground.
けんのんな手つきだ
He has an unsteady hand.
けんのんな足つきだ
He has an unsteady gait.
(いつ免職になるかも知れぬ)けんのんな地位だ
His tenure of office is precarious―He holds his position on a precarious tenure―It is a precarious position.

content: 3. (=不安心)untrustworthy (person); unreliable (promise); uncertain (event); doubtful (result, etc.)

content.content: あの男はけんのんだ
He is untrustworthy―not to be trusted.
彼の口約束はけんのんだ
His promises are unreliable―He is not to be relied upon.
けんのんな話だ
It is a doubtful story―an incredible story.
あの男に金を預けるのはけんのんだ
You can not trust him with money―He is not to be trusted with money.
この子はまだ独りで世の中へ出すのはけんのんだ
You can not trust him alone in the world―He is too young to be trusted alone in the world.
僕は(慣れないから)演説するのはけんのんだ
I can not trust myself on the platform.

〈名〉Frugality; economy; husbandry; thrift:(=な) frugal; economical; thrifty:(=する) to be frugal; to economize; to practise economy; to husband (one's resources); to save (expenses); to be saving of (money); to be sparing of (anything); to do without (anything); to pinch, pinch and scrape; to stint oneself

content.content: 彼は倹約に暮らしている
He leads a frugal life―lives on sixpence a day.
非職給で倹約に暮らしている
He economizes on his half-pay.
倹約すれば月百円でやっていける
I can get along on 100 yen a month if I practise economy.
いくら倹約しても月百円では暮らせない
With the utmost economy, I can not manage on 100 yen a month.
資本を倹約して使え
Husband your capital!
なるべく入費を倹約するように
You must save expenses as much as possible.
塩を倹約すると漬物が腐る
If you are sparing of salt, the pickles will go bad.
彼は非常な倹約家で夜のランプまでも倹約する

倹約もよいがそりゃ極端だ
It is all very well to be frugal, but that's going too far.

a frugal man―a saving man

content:

〈形〉
1. A right(往々複数―rights): a claim, a pretension(は争う権利): a title(は所有の権利):(ある場合には)business

content.content: 僕はこの財産に対する権利がある
I have a right to the property―I have a title to the property―I am entitled to the property.
君はこのことに口を出す権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter―You have no voice in the matter.
彼らは娑婆をふさぐ権利が無い
They have no business to be here.
彼はくやしくも学者だなどという権利が無い
He can not pretend to learning―He has no pretension to scholarship.
彼女はくやしくも美人だなどという権利が無い
She can not pretend to beauty―She has no pretension to beauty.
既得の権利
vested rights―vested interests
権利を争う
to lay claim to―pretend to―anything
権利を失う
to lose one's rights―(不正行為によってなら)―forfeit one's rights
権利を回復する
to recover one's rights
権利を侵害する
to intrench upon one's rights―infringe upon one's rights
権利被害者
the injured party
権利を蹂躙する
to infringe upon one's rights―trample upon one's rights―tread upon one's rights―tread one's rights underfoot―trample one's rights underfoot
権利を蹂躙されて黙っていられぬ
I will not suffer my rights to be infringed upon.
権利を主張する
to assert one's rights―insist upon one's rights―stand upon one's rights
僕は正当の権利を主張するのみだ
I only assert my lawful rights.
権利を保護する
to watch over one's rights―look after one's rights
権利を抛棄する
to renounce one's rights―disclaim one's rights―waive one's rights―relinquish one's claim―resign one's claim―forego one's claim
彼らは当然の権利のように賞与金を期待している
They expect a bonus as of right.
権利義務
rights and duties
権利者
a claimant
権利株
potential shares

content:
こ〔子〕
〈名〉
1. A child(複数―children):(男の子)a boy; a son:(女の子)a girl; a daughter:(集合的に言えば)little one's; a family; offspring; issue

content.content: 彼は子持ちだ
He has a family―He is a family man.
子無し
He has no family―His issue fails.
彼は子を持ったことが無い
He never had a family.
あの女は子を持ったことが無い
She never had a child.
子を持たぬ者は情けを知らぬ
One who has no child knows not what love is.
子を持って知る親の恩
One knows not what one owes to one's parents till one comes to have children of one's own.
夫婦は大勢子がある
The couple have many children―a large family―a numerous offspring.
好い子がたくさんある
They are blessed with many good children.
彼は子が無かった、男の子が無かった
He died without issue―died without male issue.
先妻の子が三人ある
He has three children by his first wife.
妾腹の子がある
He has a child by a concubine.
子ができる、子が生まれる
A child is born―A baby is born.
あの娘は子ができた
She has a child―She has become a mother.
二人の間に子ができた
The couple had a child between them.
二人の間にできた子が有名な太郎
The fruit of their union was the famous Taro.
子を産む
to bear children―bring forth a child―give birth to a child―have a child
女は子を産む(役)
Women bear children.
彼の細君は子を五人生んだ
His wife bore him five children―gave him five children.
先妻は子を二人生んで死んだ
His first wife died after giving birth to two children.
あの女は子を七人生んだ
She has seven children―She is the mother of seven children.
七人の子を生むとも女に心を許すな
Trust no woman even if she be the mother of seven children.
あの女は子を生んだことが無い
She never had a child.
子を生まない女
a barren woman―a sterile woman
子を生む年の女
a woman of child-bearing age
彼女はもう子を生む年じゃない
She is past the age of bearing.
子を孕む
to conceive a child
子を孕んでいる
She is (They are) with child―pregnant―in the family way―in an interesting condition.
腹の子
a child in the womb―an unborn child
女は罪人でも腹の子は罪がない
The woman may be a criminal, but the child in her womb is innocent.
腹の子の始末はどうして下さる
What are your intentions regarding her unborn child?
子を挙げる
(女は)to bear a child―(男は)―beget a child
(男が)子を設ける
to beget a child―get a child
子を育てる
to bring up a child―rear a child―raise a family
可愛い子は棒で育てろ
“Spare the rod and spoil the child”.
可愛い子には旅をさせよ
If you love your child, send him out into the world.
子を養う
to feed one's little ones―provide for one's family
彼は大勢の子を養わねばならぬ
He has a large family to provide for.
子を養うは親の義務
It is the father's duty to provide for his children.
西洋では子が親を養う義務が無い
In foreign countries, it does not lie upon the son to provide for his aged parents.
子は親に依頼する(養って貰う)
Children depend on their parents (for support).
子が親の世話になるのは当たり前だ
It is quite natural that a child should depend on its parents.
親が子の世話をするのは当たり前だ
It is proper that a father should care for his children.
子が親の手を離れる
A child leaves its parents―A son becomes independent of his father.
子を棄てる
to expose a child
焼野の雉子夜の鶴、子を思わぬ親は無し
All parents yearn for their children.
子に引かさるる親心
The parent is drawn toward the child.
子に見ること親にしかず
A parent is the best judge of his child.
この父にしてこの子あり
The son is worthy of the father―Like father, like son.
子は夫婦のかすがい
A child is the pledge of affection.
持つべきものは子なりけり
What a blessing a child is!
子は子宝
Children are a man's riches.
貧乏子だくさん
“Children are the poor man's riches.”
律義者の子だくさん
Grave men generally have large families.
死する子は眉目好し
Fair is the child doomed to early death.
不具な子ほど可愛い
A deformed child is all the dearer to its parents.
ばかな子ほど可愛い
A dunce is all the dearer to his parents.
盗人を捕えて見れば我が子なり
I find the thief to be my own son.
人は神の子
Man is the child of God.
子等は皆軍の
The sons are, one and all, away
庭に出ではてて
To guard their fatherland;
おきなやひとり
The gray-haired sire alone is left
山田もるらん
The woodland farm to tend.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 貧乏子だくさん
Poor people are prolific.
彼は誰の子だかわからない
His paternity is unknown.
彼(女)は子ができた
He rejoices in his fatherhood―She rejoices in her motherhood.
三千世界に子を持った親の心は皆一つ
Universal is parental love.
親が無くとも子は育つ
“Nature is a good mother.”
子は親に似る
“Life begets like.”
親を見習う子
“As the old cock crows, the young one learns to crow.”
あの先生は我が子のように生徒を愛する
She has a mother's love for her pupils.
彼は我が子のように世話をした
He was a second father to him.

content: 2. (=動物の子)young(は集合名詞); young ones:(虎、獅子、熊、狼などの子)a cub; a whelp:(犬の子)a pup; a puppy; a whelp:(猫の子)a kitten:(馬の子)a foal:(牡は)a colt:(牝は)a filly:(牛の子)a calf:(羊の子)a lamb:(山羊の子)a kid:(鹿の子)a fawn:(魚の子)roe; spawn:(ひと腹の子)a litter (of pigs)

content.content: 動物が子を生む

An animal brings forth its young―litters―whelps―A dog pups―A cat kittens―A mare foals―A cow calves―drops a calf―A sheep yeans―lambs―drops a lamb―A goat yeans―kids―drops a kid―A stag fawns―A tiger, a lion, a bear, or a wolf cubs―A fish spawns―spends spawn.
うちの猫は子を五匹生んだ
Our cat has five kittens.
鯡{にしん}は北海道の海岸へ群をなして子を生みに来る
Herrings come in shoals to the coast of Hokkaido to spawn.
(動物が)子を孕んでいる
An animal is with young―A dog is in pup―A horse is in foal―with foal―A cow is in calf―with calf.
人は境遇の子である
Man is the creature of circumstances.

そうなると元も子も無くなってしまう

to walk with mincing steps―mince one's steps

content.content: ご案内でしょうが

content:
こい〔故意〕
〈名〉Intention; purpose; design:(=の) intentional (act); designed (action); deliberate (lie); wilful (murder); (malice) prepense, aforethought:(=に) intentionally; purposely, on purpose, of set purpose; designedly, by design; wilfully; deliberately; of malice prepense, of malice aforethought

content.content: これを為したのは故意か偶然か
Was it done by design or by accident?
故意に為したこととしか思われない
I can not help thinking that it was an intentional act―done purposely―done on purpose―done of set purpose.
一時の出来心なら罪は軽いが故意にしたことなら軽々に看過することができぬ
If he acted on impulse, he is not much to blame; but if it was a deliberate action, it is not to be lightly passed over.
故意に人を殺す
to kill a man of malice prepense―of malice aforethought

content:
こい〔鯉〕
〈名〉The carp(複数―carp)

content.content: 麩飯で鯉を釣る
to throw a sprat to catch a whale
鯉の瀧上り
a carp shooting up a waterfall
鯉の生き作り
slices of a living carp
鯉を生き作りにする
to make slices of a living carp
緋鯉
a gold carp
真鯉
the common carp

content:
こい〔請い〕
〈名〉A request

content.content: 請いにより
at one's request
ご主人の請いによって参上しました
I have called at your master's request.
請いに応する、請いを容れる
to comply with a request―accede to a request
彼は快く僕の請いに応じた
He readily complied with my request.
知事の請いに応じてこの地位をお受けしたのだ
I have accepted this position in compliance with the request of the governor.

content:
こい〔濃い〕
〈名〉Thick (soup or hair); dense (fog); dark (colour); deep (blue); heavy (beard); strong (tea or coffee); rich (blood or wine)

content.content: 汁が濃い
The soup is thick.
墨が濃い
The ink is thick.
インキが蒸発して濃くなった
The ink has become thicker by evaporation.
彼は眉毛が濃い
He has thick eyebrows―bushy eyebrows.
髯が濃い
He has a thick beard―a heavy beard.
頭髪が濃い
He has a thick head of hair.
色が濃過ぎる
The colour is too dark―The colour is too deep.
濃い茶色
dark brown
濃い紫
deep purple
コーヒーがあまり濃い
The coffee is too strong.

content:
こい〔恋〕
〈名〉Love; tender passion:(=する) to love; to be in love

content.content: 恋する思いを初めて知った
I never knew till now what it is to be in love.
二人は同じ女を恋している
They love the same woman―They are in love with the same woman―They are rivals in love.
恋に陥る
to fall in love with some one
二人は恋仲になった
They have fallen in love with each other―They are lovers.
恋を仕掛ける
to make love to a woman―make advances to a woman―pay court to a woman―court a girl
恋の道
the lore of love
越すに越されぬ恋の道
One can not get over love.
恋のいろは
the rudiments of love
恋のかたき
a rival in love
二人は恋がたきだ
They are rivals in love.
恋の遺恨
(男同志、女同志なら)―rivalry in love―(振られた女や捨てられた男に封してなら)―the revenge of despised love
恋の遺恨は恐ろしい
Love turns into deadly hate.
恋の遺恨で友達を殺した
He killed his friend out of rivalry in love.
恋がかなわぬ
to be disappointed in love―crossed in love
かなわぬ恋
disappointed love―hopeless love
かなわぬ恋のくやしさに女を刺し殺した
He stabbed the woman in the frenzy of disappointed love.
及ばぬ恋をする
to aspire to one's hand
恋の闇路
the dark path of love―(に相当するは)―“The course of true love never did run smooth.”
恋の闇路には智者も学者も踏み迷う
All men, wise and learned,lose themselves in the maze of love.
恋に焦がれる、恋に憂き身をやつす
to pine for love―languish for love
恋に焦がれた娘
a love-lorn maiden
恋の苦労をする
to experience the sorrows of love
恋に苦労はつきもの
Love is attended with sorrows―Sorrows attend on love.
道ならぬ恋
illicit love―(女なら)―misplaced affections
熱い恋は冷めやすい
“Hot love is soon cold.”
恋に上下の隔て無し
“Love makes all men equal”―“Love puts all men on a level”―“Love levels all ranks”―“Love is a leveller.”
恋は思案の外
“Love is blind”―“Love and reason do not go together”―“When love comes in, good-by to reason.”
恋は曲者
“Love knoweth no laws.”
せかれて募る恋の情
“A fence between makes love more keen.”
恋は押し
“Faint heart never won fair lady.”
恋にはなまじ連れは邪魔
“Love and lordship like not fellowship.”
恋と戦は手段を選ばず
“All is fair in love and war.”
恋の奴隷
a slave to love
恋の神
Cupid

〈名〉A love song; an erotic (poem)

He prepared to draw his sword.

content.content: 恋焦がれた娘
a love-lorn maiden

The bittern booms.

content:

〈名〉A love-affair; an amour

content.content: 忍ぶ恋路
clandestine love―the clandestine meeting of lovers
とかく恋路はままにならぬ
“The course of true love never did run smooth.”

content:
こいしい〔恋しい〕
〈形〉Beloved:(動詞に訳せば)to love (a person); to long for (anything); to sigh for (a person); to pine for (home); to languish for (a person); to miss (anything); to be sick for (home)

content.content: 恋しい人
the person I sigh for―one I love
君の恋しい人はだれか
Whom do you sigh for?
故郷が恋しい
How I long for a sight of my native land!
彼女はうちが恋しいのだ
She pines for home―She is sick for home.
田舎へ行くと東京が恋しくなる
When you are in the country, you will miss Tokyo.
鹿の啼く声聞けば昔が恋しいわいな
The stag's cry reminds my of the past.
恋しくば尋ね来てみよ
If you love me, come and see me.
恋しい恋しいに目をなきつぶし
She cried herself blind in the excess of her love.

content:
こいしがる〔恋しがる〕
〈他動〉To long for (anything); to sigh for (a person); to languish for (a person); to miss (anything); to be sick for (home)

content.content: 君を恋しがっている人がある
Somebody sighs for you.
彼は故郷の英国を恋しがっている
He longs for a sigh of England.
彼女はうちを恋しがっている
She has a longing for a home―She pines for home―She is sick for home.
彼は別れた友人を恋しがっている
He languishes for his friends―misses his friends.

こいしたう〔恋慕う〕
〈他動〉To love; to long for, sigh for, yearn after (a person)

こいちゃ〔濃茶〕
〈名〉
1. A strong infusion of powdered tea
2. ［色］Dark brown; umber colour

content.content: こいつ失敬な奴

こいつけしからん奴
Confound the fellow!
こいつは好い
That's good.
こいつはしくじった
I've done it.
(どれになさいますかと問われて)こいつにしましよう
I'll take this one.

content: 2. (=願望する)to desire; to wish (for)

I beg you will help me―I request your assistance―I entreat you to help me.

content.content: あの女は恋人がある
She has a lover.
あれは僕の恋人だ
She is my sweetheart―my lady-love.
二人は恋人(同志)だ
They are lovers.

a love-match

to wear the willow

お嬢さんの病気は恋わずらいです
The young lady is lovesick―pining for love.
恋わずらいをしている娘
a lovesick girl―a love-lorn maiden
恋わずらいの風情のある美人
a sentimental beauty―a languishing beauty―a lackadaisical beauty

content:
こう〔乞う〕
〈他動〉
1. To ask (for something―some one for something―something of some one); to beg (for something―some one for something―something of some one); to request (something of some one); to appeal (to one for something); to apply (to some one for something); to solicit (something); to sue (for something); to pray (for something); to plead (for something)

content.content: 人に物を乞う
(有形物なら)to ask some one for something―beg some one for something―(無形物なら)―ask something of some one―beg something of some one―apply to some one for something―appeal to some one for something
一杯の水を乞うた
I asked for a glass of water.
乞食が施しを乞う
A beggar begs for alms.
一夜の宿を乞う
to ask for a night's lodging
許可を乞う
to ask permission―beg leave
先生に許可を乞うたか
Have you asked permission of your teacher?
赦免を乞う
to beg one's pardon―pray for pardon
その方にご宥恕を乞うたか
Have you begged pardon of the man?
恩恵を乞う
to ask a favour of one―solicit a favour―crave a boon
ある人来て職を乞う
A man applied to me for employment.
哀を乞う
to appeal (to the Throne) for clemency―plead for mercy
憐みを乞う
to appeal to one's pity―throw oneself on another's compassion
和を乞う
to sue for peace
同盟軍はドイツが和を乞うまで戦った
The Allies fought till Germany sued for peace.
援助を乞う
to request one's assistance―appeal for one's aid
助命を乞う
to appeal for mercy―plead for mercy―(戦場でなら)―ask for quarter―cry quarter
ご来社あらんことを乞う
I beg you will come―I request you will come―I request your attendance―I request your presence―I request the pleasure of your company.
ご留任を乞う
I beg you will stay―I request you will stay.
至急ご回答を乞う
I request you will answer as soon as possible―Please oblige me with an early answer―An early answer will oblige.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 応援を乞う
to call in some one's aid―call in some one to one's aid
支那は列国の応援を乞うた
China called in the Powers to her aid.
案内を乞う(頼もうと言う)
to call out for admission―(西洋では)―knock at the door―ring the bell
案内を乞う者あり
There is some one singing out at the door―(西洋では)―There is a knock at the door―a ring at the bell.
ペルリ来たりて互市を乞う
Commodore Perry demanded a commercial treaty.
作文の訂正を乞う
to submit a composition to one's teacher
ご訂正を乞う
I wish you would look over my composition.
設計のご閲覧を乞う
I submit my design to your inspection.
乞う無音の罪を恕せ
Do not be offended at my long silence.
乞う隗より始めよ
Begin with No. 1.
骸骨を乞う
to resign one's official post on account of old age

Now is the lingering summer season.

the Lord of Sendai

content: 3. (=公共)the public; the State

content.content: いったん急あれば義勇公に奉ぜよ
In case of emergency, offer yourself bravely to the State.

content:

content:
こう〔功〕
〈名〉
1. (=功績)a meritorious deed; merit; service(成句のほかは複数)

content.content: 功を立てる
to perform a meritorious deed―distinguish oneself―win distinction―render service
彼は国家に功を立てた
He has rendered service to the State.
抜群の功を立てる
to render distinguished services―have eminent merits
功を賞す
to reward one for one's services
功を論じ賞を行う
to reward one in recognition of his services―reward services and distribute honours
三十七八年役に功あり
He distinguished himself―rendered distinguished services―in the 37-8th year affair.
三十七八年役の功により男爵に叙せらる
He was created baron in recognition of his services in the 37-8th year affair.
功の疑わしきは重くせよ
Doubtful merit should be rewarded.
功成り名遂げて身退くは天の道なり
To render service, to win fame, and then to retire from life, is the way of Heaven.
一将功成って万骨枯る
“The many must labour for the one.”

content: 2. (=成功、効果)success; effect; result; fruit

content.content: 勉強の功だ
It is the fruit of industry.
彼は勉強の功によって成功した
He succeeded by dint of perseverance―by virtue of industry.
功を奏す
to take effect―bear fruit―do its work―be effectual―be successful―succeed―(武器なら)―do execution―tell
薬が功を奏した
The medicine has taken effect―done its work.
勉強が功を奏した
My labours have borne fruit.
試みが功を奏した
My attempt has proved effectual―been successful―succeeded.
前回の企図は功を奏さぬ
The last attempt was attended with no results―fruitless of results―ineffectual.
砲撃がことごとく功を奏した(百発百中)
Every shot did execution―Every shot told.
砲台を砲撃してもなんの功も奏さなかった
The bombardment made no impression on the forts.
労して功あり
My labours are crowned with success―My labours have borne fruit.
労して功無し
My labours are fruitless of results―I have laboured in vain―I am ill paid for my labours.
功を急ぐ
to be eager for success―anxious to succeed
功を積む
to reap the fruits of industry
蛍雪の功を積む
to burn the midnight oil
蛍雪の功むなしからず
My diligence is rewarded.

content: 3. (=誉れ)honour; credit

content.content: (医者などが)功を争う
to claim the honour of the affair―claim the credit of the affair
功を分かつ
to divide the honour of the affair―divide the credit of the affair
彼は己が功を人に譲る
He disclaims the credit of the affair.
維新の大業は薩長の功である
The credit for the great work of the Restoration in due to the Satsuma and Choshu clans.
義務を尽しただけのことをもって功とはせぬ
I do not take credit to myself for having simply done my duty―make a merit of having simply done my duty.

content: 4. (=功を経るの功)experience; wisdom

content.content: 功を経る
to grow wise by experience
さすがは年の功だ
He is experienced and wise.
イカの甲より年の功
Age will tell―Older and wiser.

content: 5. (=功何級の功)order

content.content: 功一級に叙し金鵄勲章を授けられる
He was decorated with the First Order of the Golden Kite.

content.content: 孝は百行の基
Filial piety is the beginning of all virtues―(に相当するは)―“The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.”
身体髪膚之を父母に受く、敢えて毀傷せざるは孝の始めなり
This body of mine, even to a hair, is my parents' gift; to keep it safe from harm is my first filial duty.
親に孝を尽せ
Be dutiful to your parents!―Be a good son!―Be a good daughter!
君には忠、親には孝なれ
Be faithful to your lord, and obedient to your father.
忠ならんと欲すれば孝ならず、孝ならんと欲すれば忠ならず
If I do my duty to my lord, I shall fail in my duty to my father; if I do my duty to my father, I shall fail in my duty to my lord.

A dependency pays a tribute to its sovereign state.
属国に貢を納めしむ

content.content: 鉄鉱

It falls under Clause 2, Art Ⅲ.

content.content: 香を焚く
to burn incense
着物に香を焚く
to fumigate one's clothes with incense―incense one's clothes
香を聞く
to tell incenses

an incense-burner―a censor

〈名〉A kind of goose

content:
こう〔斬う〕
〈副〉Thus; like this; (in) this way; in this manner; so

content.content: こうし給え、こうなさい
Do it this way!―Let me advise you!
僕のやり方はこうだ
This is how I go about it.
事の始末はこういう次第
This is how it happened.
こう寒くてはたまらない
I can not stand the cold.
私がこうなったのはあなたのお蔭です
You have made me what I am.
僕は時々こうなる
I am often taken in this way.
こりゃこうしてはおられぬ
There is no time to lose.
こうしてはどうか
I tell you what.
ああ言えばこう言う
If I say this, you say that―A woman will have the last word.
僕はこう見えても楠木正成の末孫だ
You behold in me a descendant of Kusunoki Masashige.
こう言うと変なようだがしかし事実だ
Strange as it may sound, it is true for all that.

content:

content.content: 妻乞う鹿
a stag panting for his mate

content:
こう〔效〕
〈名〉
1. (=效果)effect; result; fruit; avail; success

content.content: 效を奏す
to take effect―bear fruit―do its work―be effectual―be successful―succeed―(武器なら)―do execution―tell
薬が效を奏した
The medicine has taken effect―done its work.
勉強が效を奏した
My labours have borne fruit.
試みが效を奏した
My attempt has proved effectual―been successful―succeeded.
前回の企図は效を奏さなかった
The last attempt was attended with no results―fruitless of results―ineffectual.
砲撃がことごとく效を奏した(百発百中)
Every shot did execution―Every shot told.
砲台を砲撃してもなんの效も奏さなかった
The bombardment made no impression on the forts.
労して效あり
My labours are crowned with success―My labours have borne fruit.
労して效無し
My labours are fruitless of results―I have laboured in vain―I am ill paid for my labours.
彼の成功は多年勉強の效だ
His success is the result of years of study―the fruit of years of industry.
彼は勉強の効によって成功したのだ
He has succeeded by virtue of industry―by dint of perseverance.
勉強の效があって彼は今は級の首席を占めている
Owing to his diligence, he is now at the top of his class.
薬を飲んでもなんの效も無い
The medicine has no effect on me.
言ってもなんの效も無い
Talk will be of no avail―Talk will avail you nothing.
働いてもなんの效も無い
I have laboured in vain―to no purpose.
医薬その效無くて昨夜死去しました
In spite of medical aid, he breathed his last last night.

content: 2. (=效力、效能)efficiency; efficacy; virtue

content.content: この薬は效がある
The medicine has virtue―The medicine is efficacious.
キニーネは熱病に效がある
Quinine is good for fevers.
制度は人をまって始めてその效あり
An institution must depend on men for its efficiency.

content:
ごう〔郷〕
〈名〉A village; the country

content.content: 郷に入っては郷に従え
Conform to the custom of the place―“Do at Rome as the Romans do.”

content:

content.content: 業を煮やす
to stir one's bile―raise one's bile―rouse one's bile

I boiled with anger at the news―The news stirred my bile.
業をさらす
to drag out a miserable existence

content:

〈名〉
1. (=番号) the number (of a serial)

content.content: 第一号

次号

号を重ねることここに一千
The numbers come up to a thousand.
号を逐うて
with each number―in successive number
本が号を逐うて発行になる

小説を号を逐うて掲載する
A story is published serially.

content: 2. (=新聞の幾日号)(what day's) issue (of a newspaper)

content.content: 朝日の月曜号
Monday's issue of the Asahi.

content: 3. (=雅号)(a literary man's) pseudonym, pen-name, nom de plume

content.content: 高圧機関

to carry matters with a high hand

content:
こうあん〔考案〕
〈名〉An idea; a conception; a plan; a design; a scheme; a project; a device; a contrivance:(=する) to conceive; to plan; to design; to scheme; to project; to devise; to contrive; to originate

content.content: 考案と作成は一致しない
The execution does not correspond with the conception.
この計画は誰の考案ですか
Whom did the project originate with?
計画はまだ考案中
The project is still in embryo―on the anvil.

content:

content.content: 苟案を偸{ぬす}む

content:
こうい〔厚意〕
〈名〉Kind intentions; kindness

content.content: ご厚意を謝す
I thank you for your kind intentions.
厚意に酬いる
to requite one's kindness―repay one's kindness

content:
こうい〔好意〕
〈名〉Good will; good wishes; kindness; regard; courtesy

content.content: 皆彼に対して好意を持っている
Everybody wishes him well―means well by him.
僕も彼に対して好意を有する一人だ
I, for one, have a regard for him―have a kindness for him―I am one of his well-wishers.
ご好意を謝す
I thank you for your kindness.
好意を表す
to show one's good wishes
好意を表して為したことだ
It has been done in token of good will.
それではご好意に甘えて
Then I shall presume on your kindness.
ご好意を無にするのは遺憾ですが
I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kind offer.
人の好意を無にするものではない
You should not set aside people's kindness―bring people's kindness to naught.
著者の好意により(転載す)
By courtesy of the author.

content:

〈名〉A siege; an investment; a beleaguerment:(=する) to besiege, lay siege to (a fortress); to invest (a town); to beleaguer (a city)

content.content: 日本軍は旅順を攻囲した
The Japanese invested Port Arthur.
攻囲の中に陥る
to be besieged―be invested―(by the enemy)
攻囲を解く(また敵をして攻囲を解かしむ)

the invested army―the besieging army―the besiegers

content:
こうい〔行為〕
〈名〉
1. An act; an action; a deed; conduct; behaviour

content.content: 彼は話はわかっているが行為は愚者の行為だ
He talks like a man of sense, but his actions are those of a fool.
あれは私慾より出る行為だ
It is an action dictated by self-interest.
人の行為を見れば心がわかる
One's actions show one's heart.
彼は口先ばかりで行為がない
He is a man of words, and not of deeps―He is all talk and no deed.
その志は賞すべきもその行為は笑うべし
The motive is worthy of praise, but the deed deserves censure.
さすがは紳士の行為だ
His conduct is worthy of a gentleman.
紳士として恥ずべき行為だ
His conduct is unworthy of a gentleman.
己が行為を恥じて自害した

彼の敵に対する行為は賞するに余りあり
His conduct towards his enemy is above praise.
あっぱれな行為だ
Your conduct does you honour.
人の行為を賞める、人の行為を非難する
to praise one for one's conduct―blame one for one's conduct

正当行為

不正行為
a wrong action―an unlawful action―a dishonest action
試験場で不正行為をして退場を命ぜられた者がある

不道徳的行為

慈善行為

慈悲の行為

公平な行為

犯罪行為

どんな行為をする

彼は発狂者のような行為をする
He acts like a madman―behaves like a madman.
紳士らしい行為だ

帝国の光栄を宣揚する

content:

content:

content.content: 候補者佐藤氏後援会
a society in support of the candidate Mr. Sato

content:
こうえんしゃ〔後援者〕

content.content: 彼は三井という後援者がある
He has the Mitsuis at his back―He has his backers in the Mitsuis.
あの学校には大倉という後援者がある
The school has a financial supporter in the person of Mr. Okura.
あの女優には小野男爵という後援者がついている

to seize an opportunity―seize the moment
好機を逸する
to miss an opportunity―let slip an opportunity―lose one's chance
君は千載一遇の好機を逸したのだ
You have thrown away a golden opportunity.
好機を逸するな
“Take time by the forelock”―“Strike the iron while it is hot”―“Make hay while the sun shines.”
好機逸すべからず
Now(is the time)or never!
好機を利用する
to avail oneself of an opportunity―make the most of an opportunity
好機を待っている
I am watching for a chance―biding my time.
ほどなく好機があった
It was not long before an opportunity presented itself―an opportunity occurred―an opportunity offered.
こんな好機はめったに無い
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
日本はこれを好機として国力を発展すべし
Japan should take this opportunity of developing her national resources.

content:
こうき〔広軌〕
〈名〉A broad gauge; the standard gauge (of Europe and America)

content.content: 欧米の鉄道は皆広軌だ
All railways in Europe and America are of the broad gauge.
狭軌鉄道を広軌に改める
to convert a narrow gauge into a broad one―standardize a railway
広軌鉄道
a broad-gauge railway―a standardized railway

こうき〔校旗〕
〈名〉A school flag

こうき〔皇基〕
〈名〉The foundation of the Imperial rule

こうき〔皇旗〕
〈名〉The Imperial standard

content:
こうき〔綱紀〕
〈名〉Administration; law; public order

content.content: 綱紀を粛整する
to regulate the administration―purify the administration―establish public order
ロシアは一時綱紀が大いに乱れた
There was no public order―no law or order―in Russia for a time.

こうき〔降旗〕
〈名〉A white flag

content:
こうき〔香気〕
〈名〉Sweet smell; sweet odour; fragrance; perfume; scent; aroma:(=ある) sweet-smelling; sweet-scented; fragrant; odorous; aromatic

content.content: 香気芬々たり
The flowers are fragrant.
香気芬々たる花
fragrant flowers
百花の香気馥郁たり
The air (The garden) is redolent of flowers.
花は香気を発する
Flowers send forth fragrance―give out sweet odours―emit perfumes―diffuse perfumes―shed perfumes around.
梅花の香気
the perfume of plum-blossoms
薔薇の香気
the aroma of roses

content:
こうき〔高貴〕
〈形〉High (and noble); noble; exalted; august

content.content: 高貴な方々
high personages―exalted personages―august personages
そんな高貴なお方とは知らなかった
I was not aware that I was in the presence of such an august personage.
高貴な生まれの人
a man of noble birth―a man of noble blood
高貴な生まれの娘
a high-born maiden
人品骨柄さすがに高貴な生まれの人と思われた
His dignified presence bespoke his noble birth.
彼は不幸にして高貴の家に生まれた
He had the misfortune to be born in the purple.

content:
こうぎ〔交誼〕
〈名〉Friendship

content.content: 交誼を結ぶ
to contract a friendship with one
交誼を絶つ
to break off friendship with one
国際交誼
international friendship―comity of nations

こうぎ〔公儀〕
〈名〉The Shogunate government

こうぎ〔公議〕
〈名〉
1. (=輿論) public opinion
2. (=公平な議論)a just view

content:
こうぎ〔広義〕
〈名〉A wide sense; a broad sense

content.content: 広義に解釈する
to put a wide construction on the text―interpret the text in a broad sense

content:
こうぎ〔抗議〕
〈名〉A protest; a remonstrance; an objection:(法律にては)a demur, a demurrer:(=する) to protest against, remonstrate against, object to, demur to (a measure)

content.content: 政府の処置に対して抗議を申し込む
to enter a protest―lodge a protest―file a protest―with government against a measure

content:
こうぎ〔講義〕
〈名〉A lecture:(=する) to lecture (on economy); to give a lecture; to address (a class)

content.content: 先生は毎日大学で講義している
He lectures―gives a lecture―addresses his class―at the university every day.
講義を聴く
to attend a lecture
講義を欠かす
to cut a lecture
先生の講義を聴いたか
Have you attended his lectures?―heard his lectures?
先生の英文法の講義を聴いた
I have heard his lectures on English grammar.
本を講義する
to give lectures on a book―read a book with one's students
先生は今、沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}を講義している
He is reading Shakespeare with us.
講義室
a lecture-hall
講義録
a transcript of lectures

content:
こうぎ〔高義〕
〈名〉Noble conduct; high favour

content.content: 高義に感ずる
to be sensible of one's favours

ごうき〔剛毅〕
〈名〉Fortitude:(=なる) courageous in adversity; having fortitude under misfortune

ごうき〔豪気〕
〈名〉A stout heart:(=なる) stout-hearted

content:
ごうぎ〔合宜〕
〈名〉Fitness:(=なる) fit

content.content: かくあるは合宜なり
It is fit―fit and proper―that it should be so.
